title: Fort Vancouver National Historic Site: Conservation
body: Conservation       Throughout the year, conservation projects are undertaken in an effort to preserve the objects in our museum collection. While some projects are done by staff and volunteers, more complex projects are done by professional conservators. Click on the links below to learn about five of the Fort's most recent conservation endeavors. Chief Factor's House and McLoughlin House Furniture Cleaning McLoughlin House Furniture Conservation Textile Conservation Workshop Conservation of Historic Photographs Conservation of Marguerite McLoughlin's Sewing Cabinet  Â     Museum Technician Meagan Huff and Volunteer Nicole Huffman clean historic chenille embroidered dress fragments, made in the 1870s NPS PHOTO
